title: Efficient procedure to obtain an entire annex

labels.name: performance
labels.description: Improve performance of an existing feature

body:
Again the topic of large N datasets (say 400k file range). The datasets tend to be static, i.e. few versions per file (if any).

git-annex operations are essentially per file, and the smaller the files the more impact per-file overhead gets. That overhead is not necessarily caused by datalad or git-annex but is essentially inherent in the nature of things (e.g. one HTTP request per file).

I think it would be beneficial for such cases, to have a method that can "give me the entire thing" or at least "give me the entire annex" of a particular remote. In some case it will be possible to implement much faster ways to obtain the content, by e.g. streaming a large file based on a single request. I suspect that cloud-storage applications would also benefit from few requests to big files, rather then many small ones (speedwise alone, not even talking about API usage constraints).
